captions.text:
00:07
COMM: Meet the Andrade kids. Who are used

to stares wherever they go. Unlike their brothers
and sisters, siblings Ruth, Estefani and Kauan

were born with albinism. and their condition
doesn't just affect the way they look. It

poses a number of challenges for the family
and a major health warning awaits them.

00:27
COMM: Mum Rosamere from Recife, Brazil was

shocked when first daughter Ruth was born.
Rosamere was even more convinced there had

been a mix up when second child Joao Paulo
was born black.

00:46
COMM: Estefani was third followed by Kauan,

then Rebecca and finally Maria, while Rosamere
is proud of her family some of the local community
think
they are cursed.

01:18
COMM: At school the children face other challenges,

their condition causes poor eyesight so they
struggle to see the board
in lessons.

01:46
COMM: On hot days the albino children have
to shelter from the sun's dazzling rays.

01:57
COMM: Rosamere and step-father Robenilson,

who has not fathered any of the Albinos worries
that the condition makes life to difficult
for them.

02:13
COMM: To find out more they have arranged

to see dermatologist Sergio Paulo who shockingly
reveals the children are at a high risk of

melanomas
and other types of skin cancer.

02:58
COMM: Armed with new knowledge Rosamere feels

she can continue to give her kids normal lives,
while helping to protect them in better ways.

title: My Albino Children: Black Brazilian Family Have Three White-Skinned Children

comments.author: Jjayjay Jayjay

comments.text:
+Jjayjay Jayjay White/Caucasian is kinda say left side of pigmentation, 
albinos are like the edge of the left side of the scale, with gingers and 
nordic between them and white, then after white you have the gradual 
darkening of the skin, as is shown geographically, Italians/Olive skin then 
latin colors, then the persian/south american colors, and then african 
etc., though I believe that the re-emergence/continuation of dark skin tone 
to south america might have some sort of trait that stayed behind in those 
that kept moving southward from the land bridge from russia to alaska.

This is not from any scientific study, just something I've noticed

comments.author: JanuaryBlack1996

comments.text:
+JanuaryBlack1996 Again, nationality is a name conferred to those born in a 
particular Nation Example: French Is the nationality given to one born in 
France, European is not a nationality it is a region made up of different 
nationalities or nation. States combined forming a large region or 
continent known as Europe. Brazilian is a nationality, Argentinean is a 
nationality, South or Latin America is not a nationality it is a continent 
or large area where most of it's inhabitants speak a language whose root 
origin derived from Latin the language still used in the Vatican. You truly 
need too pick up a book it appears your education failed you, seriously.
comments.author: kwacou

comments.text: +kwacou latinos are people from Latin America. Ergo it's a nationality.

comments.text:

Show me the nation called Latino?  Latino is a cultural, lingistical term 
also used to describe those who speak a romace language.  It is not a race 
or nation/nationality.Any race, ethnic or phenotype can be Latino if they 
fit the above criteria as I described above.  Please look up the meaning of 
the word Latino not what ignorant people tell you.
